confirm_logout_bot: Are you sure to remove the bot?
bad_user_pwd: Connection successful, but the username or password is incorrect
bad_url: Connection failed, please check if {url}/api/ping can be accessed normally
bad_url_cors: Please also check if {url} is added to the bot configuration 'CORS_origins'
dash_desc: Banbot is a high-performance, easy-to-use trading robot. You can add and manage your real-time trading robots here.
dash_help: If you have any questions or need help, please visit:
confirm_close_all_positions: Confirm to force close all positions?
doc_desc: View detailed usage documentation and guides to get started quickly
github_desc: Visit our repository for the latest updates
wechat_desc: Join our WeChat group to exchange experiences with other users
discord_desc: Join our Discord community for real-time help
confirm_delete: Are you sure to delete {src}? This operation cannot be undone!
confirm_delete_n: Are you sure to delete {src} items? This operation cannot be undone!
bad_strat_name: Please use the format "folder:strategy", such as Trend:MaCross
only_strat_need: Please enter the strategy name directly
bad_strat_ptn: Must start with a letter, and can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores
folder_not_exist: Folder {folder} does not exist, please create it first
confirm_run: Are you sure you want to run?
local_config_desc: Save the configurations that you may frequently modify, which will overwrite items with the same name in config.yml.
build_desc: Compile the strategy and banbot into a single executable file, you can use this file for live trading, backtesting, optimization, etc.
trade_compile: Select OS and architecture, click to compile strategy and banbot to a single executable file
database_desc: Install and start TimescaleDb, and note the connection string
trade_edit_config_desc: Execute `bot init` command to initialize global config, Set api key & secret, dbConnStr, single transaction amount, market, trading pairs, message notification, Dashboard password, etc.
run_banbot_desc: Start spider process & trader: `bot spider & bot trade`
dashboard_desc: Go to Dashboard to view and manage your trading robot
confirm_build: Compiling may take several minutes, are you sure to compile?
build_for_backtest: Strategy code has been modified, would you like to compile before backtest ?
backtest_duplicate_info: Backtest task already exists, what do you want to do?
bt_result_not_exist: Backtest result does not exist, it may have been deleted or moved
heavy_task_busy: Please wait for the existing task to complete before retrying
code_modified_need_build: Code modified, please build before backtesting
export_desc: Export to protobuf format here. or execute `bot data export` in the terminal to export. If you need csv format, execute `bot kline export` from the terminal.
import_desc: Import protobuf format data here, or execute `bot data import` in the terminal to export. If you need to import `csv.zip` data, please execute `bot kline load`
timeframe_save_desc: Only save these periods; other periods will be aggregated from these.
tip_export_data_dir: absolute path of folder to save the exported data files
tip_import_data_dir: absolute path of folder which contains `dat` files to import
cfg_name: Bot name, used to distinguish different bots in message notifications
cfg_env: Running environment, prod represents production network, test represents test network (Binance testnet), dry_run represents simulation
cfg_leverage: Leverage ratio, only valid in the futures market
cfg_limit_vol_secs: The expiration time for the order book price based on trading volume, in seconds, default is 10
cfg_put_limit_secs: Limit order submission time to the exchange within which it is expected to be filled, in seconds, default is 120
cfg_account_pull_secs: The interval in seconds for regularly updating account balance and positions, default is 60 seconds.
cfg_market_type: Market type: spot for spot trading, linear for USDT-margined contracts, inverse for coin-margined contracts, option for options contracts
cfg_contract_type: swap for perpetual contracts, future for expiring contracts
cfg_odbook_ttl: Order book expiration time, in milliseconds, default is 500
cfg_concur_num: Concurrent number of symbol candle downloads, default is 2 symbols
cfg_order_type: Order type: market for market orders, limit for limit orders
cfg_stop_enter_bars: Cancel the limit entry order if it is not filled within this many candles, default is 0 (disabled)
cfg_prefire: Whether to trigger 10% ahead of the bar's completion time
cfg_margin_add_rate: For futures contracts, add margin when the loss reaches this ratio of the initial margin to avoid liquidation, default is 0.66
cfg_stake_amount: Default amount per order, lower priority than stake_pct
cfg_stake_pct: Percentage of account to use for each order, based on the nominal value
cfg_max_stake_amount: Max order amount of 5k, valid only if stake_pct is specified
cfg_draw_balance_over: When the balance exceeds this value, the excess amount will be automatically withdrawn and will not be used for subsequent transactions. It is only used for backtesting.
cfg_charge_on_bomb: Automatically recharge to continue backtesting when backtesting liquidation occurs
cfg_take_over_strat: The strategy for taking over user orders during real trading, empty by default
cfg_close_on_stuck: If no K-line is received within 20 minutes, all positions will be closed. The default value is 20. (Only valid for live trading)
cfg_open_vol_rate: Maximum allowed open order quantity / average candle volume ratio when not specifying order quantity, default is 1
cfg_min_open_rate: Minimum open order ratio, allows order if balance / per order amount exceeds this ratio when balance is insufficient, default is 0.5 (50%)
cfg_low_cost_action: Action when stake amount < the minimum amount: ignore/keepBig/keepAll
cfg_bt_net_cost: Order delay in backtest, can be used to simulate slippage, in seconds, default is 15
cfg_relay_sim_unfinish: When trading a new symbol (backtesting/live trading), whether to trading from the open order relay at the beginning time
cfg_ntp_lang_code: NTP (Network Time Protocol) real-time synchronization. The default is `none`(disabled). Supported codes: zh-CN, zh-HK, zh-TW, ja-JP, ko-KR, zh-SG, and global (indicating global NTP servers such as Google, Apple, Facebook, etc.).
cfg_order_bar_max: Find the maximum number of bars for forward simulation from the open orders at the start time.
cfg_stake_currency: Limit trading pairs to those priced in these currencies
cfg_fatal_stop: Global stop loss, forbids order placement when total loss reaches these limits
cfg_fatal_stop_hours: Prohibits order placement for this many hours when global stop loss is triggered; default is 8
cfg_time_start: K-line start time, supports timestamp, date, date-time, etc., used for backtesting, data export, etc.
cfg_run_timeframes: All allowed timeframes for the bot. The strategy will choose the most suitable minimum timeframe; this setting is lower priority than run_policy
cfg_run_policy: The strategy to run, multiple strategies can run simultaneously or a strategy can be run with different parameters
cfg_run_policy_timeframes: Timeframes supported by this strategy, overrides the root run_timeframes when provided
cfg_run_policy_filters: All filters from pairlists can be used
cfg_run_policy_max_pair: Maximum number of symbols allowed for this strategy
cfg_run_policy_max_open: Maximum number of open orders for this strategy
cfg_run_policy_max_simul_open: Maximum number of orders opened simultaneously on a candlestick
cfg_run_policy_order_bar_max: Overrides the global default order_bar_max when non-zero
cfg_run_policy_stake_rate: stake amount multiplier for this strategy
cfg_run_policy_stop_loss: stop loss rate for this strategy, e.g.: 5% or 0.05
cfg_strat_perf_enable: Whether to enable strategy symbol performance tracking, automatically reduces order size for symbols with significant losses
cfg_strat_perf_min_od_num: Minimum of 5 orders, default is 5; performance will not be calculated if fewer than 5
cfg_strat_perf_max_od_num: Maximum number of orders in a job, minimum is 8, default is 30
cfg_strat_perf_min_job_num: Minimum number of symbols, default is 10, minimum is 7
cfg_strat_perf_mid_weight: Weight for orders in the middle performance range
cfg_strat_perf_bad_weight: Weight for orders in the poor performance range
cfg_pairs: Given trading pairs, if not empty, pairlists will be ignored
cfg_pairmgr_corn: Refresh trading symbols regularly according to cron expressions (Second Minute Hour Day Month Weekday)
cfg_pairmgr_offset: Ignore the first n symbols in the list
cfg_pairmgr_limit: Keep a maximum of n symbols in the list
cfg_pairmgr_force_filters: apply pairlists to static pairs force
cfg_pairmgr_pos_on_rotation: hold/close the position when rotating the symbol list
cfg_pairmgr_use_latest: When the cron is not enabled, whether to use the latest time to refresh the varieties only takes effect for the backtest.
cfg_pairlists: Filters for trading pairs, applied sequentially in top-down order
cfg_pairlists_vol: Sort all pairs by trading volume in descending order
cfg_pairlists_max_unit_value: Max allowed unit price change value (based on quote currency, usually USDT)
cfg_price_precision: Filter pairs based on price precision, default requires price changes to be at least 0.1%
cfg_back_days: Number of days to review for candle data
cfg_spread_max: Formula: 1 - bid/ask, max price spread ratio allowed
cfg_correlation_val: Filter symbols based on correlation to the market average; default is 0 (disabled)
cfg_correlation_topn: Return only the top n symbols with the lowest correlation; default is 0 (no limit)
cfg_volatility_max: Maximum volatility score, higher values allow more volatile symbols on the daily level
cfg_volatility_min: Minimum volatility score, lower values allow symbols with less volatility on the daily level
cfg_pairlists_age: Filter symbols based on listing days
cfg_pairlists_offset: Offset limit filter, typically used last
cfg_acc_max_pair: The maximum number of product types allowed for this account
cfg_acc_max_open_orders: The maximum number of simultaneous open positions allowed for this account.
cfg_acc_api_server: The password and role to accesse the Dashboard for this account
cfg_acc_prod: API key and secret for production network, required when env is set to prod
cfg_acc_name: Account name, can be any name, used when sending rpc messages
cfg_acc_stake_rate: Order amount multiplier, relative to default
cfg_acc_lvg: Futures leverage, takes priority over the default
cfg_acc_test: API key and secret for test network, required when env is set to test
cfg_exg_options: Parameters for initializing the exchange via banexg, keys will be automatically converted from snake_case to camelCase.
cfg_db_auto_create: Whether to automatically create the database if it does not exist
cfg_spider: Port and address monitored by the spider process
cfg_rpc_channels: RPC channels for sending message notifications
cfg_rpc_account: Allowed accounts, allows all if empty
cfg_webhook: Message types that can be sent via RPC
cfg_webhook_status: Bot status messages: start, stop, etc.
cfg_api_server: For external control of the bot or access to dashboard via API
cfg_api_bind_ip: It is recommended to open only to local or LAN users. You can use SSH port forwarding or nginx to expose it to specific internet users more safely.
completion_series: Series object, Get(i) returns historical data, i=0 means the latest data
completion_cross: Positive for upward crossing, negative for downward crossing, 0 for unknown or coincident; abs(ret) - 1 indicates the distance between the crossing point and the current bar
utils_dec_pow: Calculate the power of a decimal number
utils_dec_arith_mean: Calculate the arithmetic mean of a set of decimal numbers
utils_dec_std_dev: Calculate the population standard deviation of a set of decimal numbers
utils_pad_center: Pad a string to center align with specified width
utils_random_str: Generate a random string of specified length
utils_format_with_map: Format a string using values from a map
utils_group_by_pair_quotes: Group by trading pairs and quotes
utils_split_symbol: Split trading pair symbol into base and quote currencies
btime_utc_time: Get current UTC time as 10-digit floating point seconds timestamp
btime_utc_stamp: Get current UTC time as 13-digit millisecond timestamp
btime_ms_to_time: Convert 13-digit millisecond timestamp to time.Time object
btime_parse_time_ms: Convert time string to 13-digit millisecond timestamp
btime_parse_time_ms_by: Parse time string to 13-digit millisecond timestamp using specified format
btime_to_date_str: Convert timestamp to time string in UTC timezone
btime_to_date_str_loc: Convert timestamp to time string in specified timezone
config_get_take_over_tf: Get takeover timeframe for specified trading pair
config_get_stake_amount: Get stake amount for specified account
ohlcv_fetch_api_ohlcv: Fetch candlestick data from exchange API
ohlcv_apply_adj: Apply price adjustment factors to candlestick data
strat_get_jobs: Get all strategy tasks for specified account
strat_get_info_jobs: Get information strategy tasks for specified account
ta_cross: Determine crossing between two series, positive for upward crossing, negative for downward crossing, 0 for unknown or coincident
ta_sum: Calculate sum of series over specified period
ta_ema_by: Calculate Exponential Moving Average with specified initialization type
ta_rma_by: Calculate Relative Strength Moving Average with specified parameters
ta_macd_by: Calculate MACD indicator with specified initialization type
ta_crsi_by: Calculate Custom RSI with specified parameters
ta_highest: Calculate highest value over specified period
ta_highest_bar: Calculate position of highest value over specified period
ta_lowest: Calculate lowest value over specified period
ta_lowest_bar: Calculate position of lowest value over specified period
ta_kdj_by: Calculate KDJ indicator with specified parameters
ta_stddev_by: Calculate Standard Deviation with specified parameters
ta_adx_by: Calculate Average Directional Index with specified method
ta_kama_by: Calculate Kaufman Adaptive Moving Average with specified parameters
ta_cmo_by: Calculate Chande Momentum Oscillator with specified parameters
count_digit: Count the number of digits in a string
split_solid: Split string and ignore empty strings
keys_of_map: Get all keys of a map
vals_of_map: Get all values of a map
cut_map: Extract a subset of keys from a map
union_arr: Merge multiple arrays and remove duplicates
convert_arr: Convert an array of one type to another
arr_to_map: Convert an array to a map
remove_from_arr: Remove specified element from an array
unique_items: Get unique elements and duplicates from an array
map_to_str: Convert a map to a string representation
calc_envs_corr: Calculate correlation of multiple bar environments
calc_expectancy: Calculate profit expectancy and risk-reward ratio
kmeans_vals: Perform K-means clustering on a value series
is_text_content: Check if data is text content
is_docker: Check if running in a Docker container
get_price: Get the latest price of a trading pair
get_price_safe: Safely get the price of a trading pair
is_maker: Determine if the current price is a maker price
is_fiat: Determine if it is a fiat currency code
split_symbol_core: Split trading pair symbol into base and quote currencies
pnorm_f: Create normal distribution parameter with mean and rate
is_limit_order: Determine if it is a limit order
is_price_empty: Check if price cache is empty
